title: Do you really see the world as it is ? Aren't you fooling yourself with your perception? - Quora

response.answer_text: None of us sees the world as it is. One example: An average atom occupies about 4 trillion times the space of its nucleus. For perspective, if this atom were about eight blocks across (about 2/5 of a mile), its nucleus would be the size of a tennis ball, and each electron (and each of the quarks that makes up a proton or neutron) would be the size of a small grit of sand. Thus, all the “solid” material of the world is mostly empty space, and its actual mass is tiny in size. We don’t see the world this way, but that’s how it is. More than this, everything I know about a rock is perceived as reflected light (entering my visual receptors) or a tactile/kinesthetic reception, both of which pass through my perceptual mechanism, then enter my brain, where I form a mental “picture” of the rock. Then, there’s an added complication. My brother loves liver and it makes me retch. We both perceive the same thing differently, although we agree it’s liver. Same thing with the rock. There’s no way to know how differently you and I actually perceive anything about the world. We may agree on a name for something, but that’s not any indication that we “see” it the same way — just like liver. So, no, I wouldn’t say I am fooling myself. What I am saying is that, whatever the world is, it is — but I’m under no illusion that I know fully what it is. Here’s the interesting part — we still have to do the laundry. We still live, and our awareness is awesome. I watched a brilliant and windy sunrise this morning. All the atoms aligned and showered upon me such beauty that I was speechless. Then a cat sat in my lap and purred as my wife and I drank our morning coffee. These things are as real as it gets. So, to paraphrase Heraclitus, it is and is not a morning in the world. Now, you tell me. Am I fooling myself or not?

None of us ‘see’ the world as it is, because the world is not really hard matter, but waves that our minds have learned to interpret, with the help of the Cosmic Mind, having learned to ‘see’ as solid. Since I study such things, and write about them, I know this is True, but also deal with waves as though they were hard matter-like bits of Energy and thoughts as though they were not mostly aspects of Pure Information fields (more Spirit than anything). In a world where some are trying to come to grips with the apparent reality that we have data and equations to describe only about 4.6% of the Energy and matter that must be in this universe, for it to behave as it does; we still have blockheads telling us that they know just about everything there is to know (well except for the unimportant 95.5% that is irrelevant! LoL! How can 95.5% be irrelevant? From that, and more troubling understandings, yes, we are fooling ourselves! Trust me, for a while, however; it is way worse than it sounds! So laugh a lit!

I see the world roughly the same way that anyone else with human eyes and senses see it; that’s part of the bargain a soul accepts when it incarnates. The animal body the soul bonds to has sensory functions sufficiently accurate to keep that species of animal (in our case, H. sap sap) around as a successful survivor. That’s all the “reality” that’s required. Is that “fooling ourselves”? I don’t think so. I think it’s an example of accepting the conditionality of existing on the physical plane, which is all about conditions: under these particular conditions you can light a fire; under those, you cannot. Exactly what constitutes those conditions, apart from your senses’ apprehension of them, is interesting and often useful to think about, but the pressures challenging our survival determine how our senses work to preserve us. IMO, souls come here via incarnation exactly to experience the power and beauty of conditionality, which may not be encountered anywhere else that souls exist except on the physical plane.
